edu.biu.scapi.comm.multiPartyComm

Class SSLSocketMultipartyCommunicationSetup

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.comm.multiPartyComm.SocketMultipartyCommunicationSetup
      • edu.biu.scapi.comm.multiPartyComm.SSLSocketMultipartyCommunicationSetup
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MultipartyCommunicationSetup, org.apache.commons.exec.TimeoutObserver

    public class SSLSocketMultipartyCommunicationSetup
extends SocketMultipartyCommunicationSetup
    This class implements a communication between multiple parties using SSL sockets.

    It derives the SocketMultipartyCommunicationSetup class since the implementation is equal except the channel type. This class creates an SSLSocketChannel while the SocketMultipartyCommunicationSetup creates a PlainTCPSocketChannel.

    In order to create an sslSocket you should have an SSLContext which should be loaded with the key store and trust store. The keyStore contains the certificate that should be sent to the other party, in SCAPI the default name is "scapiKeystore". The trustStore contains the certificate that should be received from the other party, in SCAPI the default name as "scapiCacerts". This loading is done once in the constructor of this class and is passed to the SSLSocketMultipartyListenerThread and to each SSLSocketChannel. This factory is used to send the certificate of this application.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)
